## Experience

**2024 ∙ OECD ∙ Intern**\
I am an intern at OECD in the Environment Directorate, more specifically in the team studying interlinkages between innovation and environment. I work primarily on critical raw materials, but also on mapping the twin transition.\
I have experience working with EPO database PATSTAT. I also took advantage of my time there to follow [Nelson Amaya's workshop on R](https://r4dev.netlify.app/), and you can find some of my work from this course [here](/projects/2024-oecd-r-workshop.qmd).\
\

**2023 ∙ University of Bordeaux ∙ Research Assistant for Prof. Delphine Boutin**\

-   Developed R script for text analysis

\
**2023 ∙ French Ministry of Higher Education and Research ∙ Statistician (intern)**\

-   Managed a national survey from launch to the publication of results (*Enquête Ecole doctorale*)\
-   Oversaw data collection process\
-   Cleaned and analyzed quantitative data\
-   Developed automated process for data management\
-   Produced extensive descriptive statistics\
-   Translated SAS code to R

\
**Summer 2022 ∙ INSERM/ISPED ∙ Research assistant for Prof. Jérôme Wittwer**\

-   Contributed to economic evaluation (micro-costing) of a cancer treatment.\
-   Analyzed quantitative survey data
